text: Rebecca Ann Caroll (born 1969)"Rebecca Carroll." Contemporary Authors Online. Gale, 2005. Retrieved via Biography In Context database, 16 December 2018. is an American writer, editor and radio producer. She is producer of special projects at WNYC and author of books including Sugar in the Raw: Voices of Young Black Girls in America and Saving the Race: Conversations on Du Bois from a Collective Memoir of Souls. She is a producer of the podcast on gentrification in Brooklyn There Goes the Neighborhood (produced with The Nation). Previously she was managing editor at xoJane and was the founding editor at Africana.com. ==References== Category:1969 births Category:Living people Category:African-American women writers Category:American podcasters Category:American radio producers Category:American women podcasters Category:American women writers Category:Hampshire College alumni Category:University of New Hampshire alumni Category:Writers from New Hampshire
title: Rebecca Carroll
